requirement: No subservice organizations can be carved out from a SOC 3 report. All subservice organizations must be included in the scope of the engagement.
title: Inclusion of Subservice Organizations in SOC 3 Reports
description: All subservice organizations must be included in the scope of the SOC 3 engagement, without exceptions.
testing_procedures: Review the SOC 3 report to ensure all subservice organizations are included.
Verify the scope of the engagement to confirm the inclusion of all subservice organizations.
remediation:
Ensure all subservice organizations are included in the SOC 3 report scope
Identify all subservice organizations involved in the service delivery.
Review the engagement scope to include all identified subservice organizations.
Update the SOC 3 report to reflect the inclusion of all subservice organizations.

requirement: All significant controls relevant to meet the applicable Trust Services Principles need to be encompassed in the SOC 3 report. Complementary user entity controls cannot be used to address these Trust Services Principles, in the SOC3 report.
title: Coverage of Trust Services Principles in SOC 3 Reports
description: SOC 3 reports must encompass all significant controls relevant to meet the applicable Trust Services Principles.
testing_procedures: Review the SOC 3 report to ensure it includes all significant controls relevant to the Trust Services Principles.
Assess the report to confirm that complementary user entity controls are not used to address Trust Services Principles.
remediation:
Ensure all significant controls relevant to Trust Services Principles are included in the SOC 3 report
Identify all controls relevant to the Trust Services Principles.
Review and update the SOC 3 report to include all identified controls.
Ensure complementary user entity controls are not used as a substitute for addressing Trust Services Principles within the SOC 3 report.

requirement: Service organizations must ensure that their system description is fairly presented and that the controls are suitably designed to meet the Trust Service criteria.
title: Type 1 Report Suitability of Design
description: The service auditor must express an opinion on whether the description of the service organization's systems is fairly presented and whether the controls included in the description are suitably designed to meet the applicable Trust Service criteria as of a point in time.
testing_procedures: Review the service organization's system description for fairness and completeness.
Assess whether the controls are suitably designed to meet the Trust Service criteria.
remediation:
Ensure accurate system description and control design
Prepare a comprehensive and fair system description.
Design controls that are suitable to meet the Trust Service criteria.

requirement: Service organizations must ensure that their controls are not only suitably designed but also operating effectively over the reporting period.
title: Type 2 Report Suitability and Operating Effectiveness
description: The service auditor's report must include opinions on both the suitability of the design of controls and the operating effectiveness of those controls over a specified period.
testing_procedures: Review the design of controls to ensure they meet the Trust Service criteria.
Perform tests on the operating effectiveness of controls and document the results.
remediation:
Ensure control effectiveness and proper design
Regularly test control effectiveness over the specified period.
Document any deficiencies and take corrective action.

requirement: Service organizations should consider a Type 1 report when the system has not been in operation for a significant length of time, significant changes have been made to the system and related controls, or for new services/new reports in their first year.
title: Circumstances for Type 1 Report Usefulness
description: Identifies specific circumstances under which a Type 1 report might be particularly useful for a service organization.
testing_procedures: Evaluate the operational period of the system.
Assess recent significant changes to the system and controls.
Consider the reporting needs for new services or first-year reporting.
remediation:
Evaluate the need for Type 1 reporting
Determine if the system's operational period or recent changes make a Type 1 report more applicable.
Consider Type 1 reporting for new services or as an initial step before Type 2 reporting.

requirement: A System consists of five key components organized to achieve a specified objective. The five components are categorized as follows: Infrastructure, Software, People, Procedures, Data.
title: System Component Definition
description: A system must consist of five key components organized to achieve a specified objective: Infrastructure, Software, People, Procedures, and Data.
testing_procedures: Review system documentation to verify all five components are defined and integrated.
Interview system managers and personnel to confirm understanding and implementation of the system components.
remediation:
Ensure system is comprehensively defined across all five key components
Document the infrastructure, software, people, procedures, and data components of the system.
Verify the integration and interaction of these components towards achieving the system's objectives.

requirement: The system must be evaluated and reported on controls related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.
title: Trust Services Principles
description: The system must adhere to the five Trust Services Principles: Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy.
testing_procedures: Assess system controls against each of the five Trust Services Principles.
Conduct tests to verify the effectiveness and implementation of controls related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.
remediation:
Implement and maintain controls for each Trust Services Principle
Define and document policies and procedures that support each of the five Trust Services Principles.
Regularly test and monitor the effectiveness of these controls.
Address any deficiencies identified during testing and monitoring.

requirement: The entity defines and documents its policies for the Trust Services Principle of its system, communicates these policies to responsible parties and authorized users, places in operation procedures to achieve its documented objectives in accordance with its defined policies, and monitors the system to maintain compliance with its defined system Trust Services Principle policies.
title: Trust Principles Criteria Components
description: The entity must define, document, communicate, operate, and monitor policies and procedures for each Trust Services Principle.
testing_procedures: Review policy and procedure documentation for completeness and relevance to the Trust Services Principles.
Verify communication of policies to relevant parties.
Evaluate the operational effectiveness of procedures designed to meet Trust Services Principles.
Assess the monitoring processes in place for maintaining compliance with Trust Services Principles.
remediation:
Ensure policies and procedures are effectively defined, communicated, operated, and monitored
Document and regularly update policies and procedures related to Trust Services Principles.
Ensure policies are communicated effectively to all relevant parties.
Operate and regularly review procedures to ensure they meet the defined objectives.
Implement monitoring mechanisms to ensure ongoing compliance with Trust Services Principles.

requirement: The Security Principle refers to the protection of the system from unauthorized logical and physical access. Limiting access to the system helps prevent potential abuse of the system, theft of resources, misuse of software, and improper access to, or the use, alteration, destruction, or disclosure of information.
title: Security Principle
description: The system must be protected against unauthorized access, both physical and logical.
testing_procedures: Review access control policies and procedures.
Conduct tests to verify the effectiveness of physical and logical access controls.
Assess mechanisms in place for preventing unauthorized access.
remediation:
Implement and maintain robust access control measures
Define and document access control policies and procedures.
Implement physical and logical access controls based on the principle of least privilege.
Regularly review and update access controls to adapt to new threats and changes in the system.

requirement: The system must be accessible for processing, monitoring, and maintenance as advertised or committed by contract, service-level, or other agreements.
title: System Availability Maintenance
description: The system must be available for operation and use as committed or agreed.
testing_procedures: Review service-level agreements (SLAs) to verify availability commitments.
Inspect system monitoring logs for uptime and accessibility.
Evaluate maintenance records to ensure regular system checks.
remediation:
Ensure system availability
Implement monitoring solutions for real-time system status.
Schedule regular maintenance and system checks.
Establish a disaster recovery center for continuity.

requirement: The system must perform its intended function in an unimpaired manner, free from unauthorized or inadvertent manipulation, ensuring completeness, accuracy, validity, timeliness, and authorization of system processing.
title: Processing Integrity
description: System processing must be complete, accurate, timely, and authorized.
testing_procedures: Audit transaction logs for completeness and accuracy.
Verify system processing against business values and expectations.
Check for proper authorization and privileges for system processing.
remediation:
Ensure processing integrity
Implement transaction logging and monitoring.
Define and enforce processing authorization controls.
Regularly review and validate system processing against business requirements.

requirement: The system must protect information designated as confidential, as committed or agreed, including intellectual property and client/customer lists.
title: Confidentiality of Information
description: Information designated as confidential must be protected as committed or agreed.
testing_procedures: Inspect confidentiality agreements and commitments.
Review access controls and encryption measures for confidential information.
Audit logs for unauthorized access attempts to confidential information.
remediation:
Protect confidential information
Implement strong access control policies.
Encrypt confidential data both at rest and in transit.
Regularly audit access and encryption controls.

requirement: The entity must adhere to GAPP criteria for the privacy of personal information, including notice, choice and consent, collection, use, retention, and disposal.
title: Privacy of Personal Information
description: Personal information must be collected, used, retained, disclosed, and disposed of in conformity with the entity's privacy notice and GAPP criteria.
testing_procedures: Review the entity's privacy notice for compliance with GAPP.
Verify processes for obtaining consent for the use of personal information.
Audit data retention and disposal policies for compliance with privacy commitments.
remediation:
Ensure privacy of personal information
Publish and maintain an accurate privacy notice.
Implement mechanisms for obtaining and recording consent.
Establish and enforce data retention and disposal policies.
